osprey 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Using Osprey TLGs with teal

Create an Adverse Events (AET02) Table

t_ae.Rd

t_ae returns adverse events according to STREAM format AET02

t_ae(class, term, id, col_by, total = "All Patients", sort_by = "count",
  ...)

Arguments

class

system organ class variable.
term

preferred term variable.
id

unique subject identifier variable. If a particular subject has no adverse event then the subject id should be listed where class and term should be set to missing (i.e. NA).
col_by

group variable that will be used for a column header. col_by has to be a factor and can not be missing.
total

character string that will be used as a label for a column with pooled total population, default here is "All Patients", if set to "NONE" then the "All Patients" column is suppressed.
sort_by

character string that defines the ordering of the class and term variables in the output table, options: "alphabetical" or "count", default here is set to "count"

Value

rtable object

Examples

# Simple example
library(tibble)
library(dplyr)
library(rtables)

ASL <- tibble(
  USUBJID = paste0("id-", 1:10),
  ARM = paste("ARM", LETTERS[rep(c(1,2), c(3,7))])
)


ae_lookup <- tribble(
~CLASS,         ~TERM,   ~GRADE,
"cl A",   "trm A_1/2",        1,
"cl A",   "trm A_2/2",        2,
"cl B",   "trm B_1/3",        2,
"cl B",   "trm B_2/3",        3,
"cl B",   "trm B_3/3",        1,
"cl C",   "trm C_1/1",        1
)

AAE <- cbind(
  tibble(
    USUBJID = ASL$USUBJID[c(2,2,2,3,3,4,4,4,4,5,6,6,7,7)]
  ),
  ae_lookup[c(1,1,2,6,4,2,2,3,4,2,1,5,4,6),]
)

ANL <- left_join(ASL, AAE, by = "USUBJID")

tbl <- t_ae(
  class = ANL$CLASS,
  term =  ANL$TERM,
  id = ANL$USUBJID,
  col_by = factor(ANL$ARM),
  total = "All Patients",
)

tbl
#> MedDRA System Organ Class                                            ARM A               ARM B            All Patients
#>   MedDRA Preferred Term                                              (N=3)               (N=7)               (N=10)   
#> ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Total number of patients with at least one adverse event           2 (66.7%)           4 (57.1%)            6 (60%)   
#> 
#> Overall total number of events                                         5                   9                   14     
#> cl A
#>   Total number of patients with at least one adverse event         1 (33.3%)           3 (42.9%)            4 (40%)   
#> 
#>   Total number of events                                               3                   4                   7      
#> 
#>   trm A_2/2                                                        1 (33.3%)           2 (28.6%)            3 (30%)   
#> 
#>   trm A_1/2                                                        1 (33.3%)           1 (14.3%)            2 (20%)   
#> 
#> cl B
#>   Total number of patients with at least one adverse event         1 (33.3%)           3 (42.9%)            4 (40%)   
#> 
#>   Total number of events                                               1                   4                   5      
#> 
#>   trm B_2/3                                                        1 (33.3%)           2 (28.6%)            3 (30%)   
#> 
#>   trm B_1/3                                                            0               1 (14.3%)            1 (10%)   
#> 
#>   trm B_3/3                                                            0               1 (14.3%)            1 (10%)   
#> 
#> cl C
#>   Total number of patients with at least one adverse event         1 (33.3%)           1 (14.3%)            2 (20%)   
#> 
#>   Total number of events                                               1                   1                   2      
#> 
#>   trm C_1/1                                                        1 (33.3%)           1 (14.3%)            2 (20%)   

# Simple example 2

library(dplyr)
library(rtables)
library(random.cdisc.data)


data <- left_join(radam("AAE", N=10),radam("ADSL", N=10))
#> Joining, by = c("STUDYID", "USUBJID")

tbl4 <- t_ae(
  class = data$AEBODSYS,
  term =  data$AEDECOD,
  id = data$USUBJID,
  col_by = factor(data$ARM),
  total = "None",
  sort_by = "alphabetical"
)

tbl4

#>   MedDRA Preferred Term                                                      (N=5)            (N=5)           (N=10)

data <- read_bce("/opt/BIOSTAT/home_ext2/qit3/cdt70194/go39733/libraries/adae.sas7bdat")
#> Error in read_bce("/opt/BIOSTAT/home_ext2/qit3/cdt70194/go39733/libraries/adae.sas7bdat"): could not find function "read_bce"

tbl5 <- t_ae(
  class = data$AEBODSYS,
  term =  data$AEDECOD,
  id = data$USUBJID,
  col_by = factor(data$ARM)
